title: Instruments that are harmonious with a piano and violin
body: I'm a proficient piano player and i'm looking for an instrument that synchronises with a piano and violin. I have two mates who play these instruments and I'm looking to join in as a triplet. I know these are the wrong forums, but I just find myself more comfortable posting in these ones :D

replies.body: Generally I play classical, pop and sometimes, j-pop
Not sure if troll or serious for harp ...

For Duet Piano and Violin or piano and Cello
Trio Piano violin and cello
Quartet Piano, Violin,Viola, Cello
Quintet Piano, 2 violins, 1 Viola, 1 Cello

This is what my music theory book says ... 
I believe this means that all string instruments harmonises with piano.
Well piano is  more of a solo instrument so i guess the accompany can be anything and will depend more on the style of the music more than how well they harmonise because really if you play the same note or play a same chord at the same time with different instruments they should harmonise unless one of them is out of tune.
I want to say something that would be low in pitch, like a type of drum or bass, but I honestly don't know enough about music.
